The IOHRM program is ranked 2nd in the nation for program culture, 3rd in the nation for program resources, and 7th in the nation for program costs (Kraiger & Abalos, 2004). The 2-year, 51-credit program places an emphasis on developing both a knowledge of the work-related theories, methods, and research findings from the behavioral sciences and an understanding of how to apply these to organizational activities such as recruitment and selection, training and development, performance appraisal, and organizational development.•	Was awarded full-ride scholarship to top ranked graduate program-	Received Chancellor’s Fellowship, highest merit-based award at graduate level offered to 10 students per year in 1700-student graduate school ($10,000)-	Received North Carolina Tuition Scholarship, merit-based award offered to 56 out-of-state students per year in 1700-student graduate school ($26,000)•	Passed comprehensive examination with highest honors

The Interdisciplinary Business concentration is designed for students concurrently enrolled in a second master's program at Appalachian State who are looking to supplement their primary program of study with a broader and deeper understanding of how organizations operate. As part of the 36-credit program, students take courses in managerial accounting, managerial finance, economics, marketing strategy, operations and supply chain management, business analytics, and strategic management.•	Was invited to join Beta Gamma Sigma, honor society recognizing top 20% of MBA students•	Received Outstanding Academic Achievement Award for graduating at top of class•	Scored at 97th percentile on Educational Testing Services (ETS) Major Field Test (MFT) for accredited MBA programs

The St. John's program is an all-required curriculum based on the study and discussion of original sources. Central to the program is the 4-year seminar in which the seminal works of Western civilization are read and discussed. The program also includes four years of mathematics and foreign language study, three years of laboratory science, and two years of music. If this program were to be analyzed by credits into majors and minors, it would yield two majors, one in the History of Mathematics and Science and the other in Philosophy, as well as two minors in Classics and Comparative Literature.•	Wrote and defended senior thesis on Plato’s Theaetetus
